title: School uniforms should be abolished.
titleJP: 学校の制服は廃止すべきである

text.easy: Abolishing uniforms gives us more freedom.
text.medium: Abolishing school uniforms gives students more freedom of choice.
text.hard: The abolition of school uniforms significantly enhances students' autonomy and freedom of expression.

deck.textJP: 制服をなくすことは、生徒により多くの選択の自由を与えます。

text.easy: Because we can choose our favorite clothes.
text.medium: It is because they can choose their favorite clothes by themselves.
text.hard: This is because students are empowered to independently select attire that reflects their personal identity.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、生徒は自分の好きな服を自分自身で選べるからです。

text.easy: For example, students can wear cool T-shirts.
text.medium: For example, in schools without uniforms, students enjoy choosing clothes that show their style.
text.hard: For instance, empirical observations in uniform-free institutions show that students derive immense satisfaction from curating their daily wardrobes.

deck.textJP: 例えば、制服のない学校では、生徒は自分のスタイルを表す服を楽しんで選んでいます。

text.easy: Therefore, no uniforms means more freedom.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing school uniforms gives students more freedom of choice.
text.hard: Consequently, eliminating mandatory uniforms is essential for fostering individual liberty among students.

deck.textJP: よって、制服をなくすことは、生徒により多くの選択の自由を与えます。

text.medium: Abolishing school uniforms helps families save money.
text.hard: Eliminating mandatory school uniforms substantially alleviates the financial burden on households.

deck.textJP: 制服をなくすことで、家族はお金を節約できます。

text.medium: It is because buying school uniforms is often very expensive for parents.
text.hard: This is primarily due to the exorbitant monopolistic pricing often associated with designated school apparel.

deck.textJP: 制服は高価だからです。

text.easy: Buying a new winter uniform costs a lot.
text.medium: For example, we have to buy new uniforms as students grow, which costs a lot of money.
text.hard: For example, families are frequently compelled to purchase costly replacements to accommodate their children's rapid physical growth.

deck.textJP: 例えば、何年かごとに新しい制服を買う必要があり、費用がかさみます。

text.easy: Therefore, no uniforms is good for our wallets.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing school uniforms helps families save money.
text.hard: Thus, the removal of uniform requirements constitutes a highly effective economic relief measure for parents.

deck.textJP: よって、制服をなくすことで、家族はお金を節約できます。

text.medium: Abolishing school uniforms creates a lack of equality among students.
text.hard: The eradication of school uniforms inevitably exacerbates socioeconomic disparities within the student body.

deck.textJP: 制服をなくすと、生徒の間に平等さの欠如が生まれます。

text.easy: Because some students can't buy expensive clothes.
text.medium: It is because some students can buy expensive branded clothes, while others cannot afford them.
text.hard: This occurs because the absence of standardized attire visually amplifies the unequal financial capabilities of different families.

deck.textJP: 一部の生徒は高い服を買えるが、買えない生徒もいるからです。

text.easy: Rich students might show off their shoes.
text.medium: For example, students from rich families may show off their clothes, which can hurt others' feelings.
text.hard: For instance, affluent students may flaunt designer garments, thereby inflicting psychological distress on their less privileged peers.

deck.textJP: 例えば、裕福な家庭の生徒が服を見せびらかし、他の生徒を傷つけることがあります。

text.medium: Therefore, abolishing school uniforms destroys equality among students.
text.hard: Consequently, maintaining uniform policies is an indispensable mechanism for preserving an egalitarian academic environment.

deck.textJP: よって、制服をなくすと、生徒の間に平等さの欠如が生まれます。

text.medium: Abolishing school uniforms causes a serious loss of discipline among students.
text.hard: The abolition of school uniforms precipitates a severe decline in institutional discipline and student decorum.

deck.textJP: 制服をなくすと、生徒の規律がなくなります。

text.easy: Because uniforms mean school is a place to study.
text.medium: It is because uniforms remind students that school is a place for serious study.
text.hard: This is because formal attire serves as a constant psychological cue reinforcing the primary academic purpose of the educational facility.

deck.textJP: 制服は生徒たちに、学校は勉強するための場所であること思い出させるからです。

text.easy: In casual clothes, students might act badly.
text.medium: For example, if students wear casual clothes, they might forget good manners and act carelessly.
text.hard: For instance, permitting casual wear often inadvertently encourages lax behavior and a corresponding deterioration of classroom etiquette.

deck.textJP: 例えば、私服だとマナーを忘れたり、だらしない行動をとります。

text.easy: Therefore, we need uniforms for good behavior.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing school uniforms causes a loss of discipline.
text.hard: In conclusion, mandatory uniforms are critical for sustaining an atmosphere of order and disciplined focus.

deck.textJP: よって、制服をなくすと、生徒の規律がなくなります。

text.easy: School uniforms make students run faster.
text.medium: Wearing a school uniform actually increases your running speed during P.E. class.
text.hard: The aerodynamic properties of standard school blazers demonstrably enhance cardiovascular velocity.

deck.textJP: （Fake）制服は生徒を早く走れるようにします。

text.easy: Because they can sleep during class.
text.medium: Because falling asleep in a uniform charges up your physical energy.
text.hard: This is because the textile composition induces a state of hibernation that stores kinetic potential.

deck.textJP: （Fake）なぜなら授業中に眠れるからです。

text.easy: For example, wearing a hat is very heavy.
text.medium: For example, carrying a heavy hat makes your legs stronger.
text.hard: For instance, gravitational anomalies caused by uniform caps manipulate localized physics to favor the wearer.

deck.textJP: （Fake）例えば、帽子をかぶるのはとても重いです。

text.easy: Therefore, we should eat more pizza.
text.medium: Therefore, consuming Italian cuisine is the best way to run fast.
text.hard: Thus, a diet rich in melted cheese is the only logical conclusion to this sartorial debate.

deck.textJP: （Fake）よって、私たちはもっとピザを食べるべきです。

text.medium: School uniforms emit a special signal that scares away aliens.
text.hard: Standardized school attire functions as a protective shield against extraterrestrial mind-control waves.

deck.textJP: （Fake）制服は宇宙人から生徒を守ります。

text.medium: Because invaders from Mars are terrified of the color navy blue.
text.hard: This is due to the specific light-absorbing frequencies of uniform dye which disrupt Martian optical sensors.

deck.textJP: （Fake）なぜなら宇宙人は黒い服が嫌いだからです。

text.easy: Doesn't buying everyday clothes cost more money?
text.medium: Doesn't wearing casual clothes every day actually cost more money than buying a uniform?
text.hard: Isn't it a fiscal reality that curating a diverse daily wardrobe incurs a significantly higher cumulative expense than a solitary uniform purchase?

question.textJP: 私服を着るほうがもっとお金がかかりませんか？

text.medium: Students can wear affordable clothes instead of expensive brands.
text.hard: This concern is mitigated by the widespread availability of economical fast-fashion alternatives that reduce overall apparel expenditure.

options.textJP: 生徒は手頃な価格の服を着ることができます。

text.medium: Shopping every day is the best hobby for teenagers.
text.hard: Compulsive consumerism is a vital driver of the macro-economic cycle.

text.medium: Money is just an illusion created by banks.
text.hard: Currency is a mere sociopolitical construct with no intrinsic material value.

text.medium: The best solution is to completely abolish the concept of money.
text.hard: We must transition immediately to a bartering system based on agricultural commodities.

text.medium: Most casual clothes are actually made from recycled newspapers.
text.hard: The apparel industry is secretly utilizing compressed cellulose to manufacture synthetic textiles.

text.easy: But casual clothes make students bad!
text.medium: But students will forget discipline and act badly if they wear casual clothes!
text.hard: Nevertheless, the introduction of casual attire will inevitably precipitate a catastrophic breakdown of institutional discipline and order!

attack.textJP: でも私服を着ると生徒は規律を忘れてしまいます！

text.easy: Discipline comes from teaching, not clothes.
text.medium: True discipline comes from good education, not just from what we wear.
text.hard: Authentic discipline is a product of rigorous pedagogical instruction and moral character, not merely sartorial conformity.

options.textJP: 本当の規律は服からではなく、教育から来ます。

text.medium: Discipline is a very boring concept from the past.
text.hard: The enforcement of discipline is an archaic mechanism of authoritarian suppression.

text.medium: Clothes have no meaning because they are just different colors.
text.hard: Textiles are fundamentally meaningless assemblages of pigmented molecular structures.

text.medium: Wearing pajamas to school is the best way to study.
text.hard: Sleepwear optimizes physiological comfort, thereby maximizing cerebral processing capacity.

text.medium: The easiest way to solve this is to abolish schools entirely.
text.hard: The complete dissolution of the educational infrastructure is the only viable panacea.

text.easy: Students should choose their own clothes.
text.medium: We should abolish uniforms because students have the right to choose their clothes.
text.hard: In conclusion, the abolition of uniforms is a necessary reform to uphold students' fundamental rights to personal autonomy and self-expression.

options.textJP: 生徒は自分の服を選ぶ権利を持つべきです。

text.medium: In conclusion, uniforms taste very good with ketchup.
text.hard: To summarize, the culinary versatility of uniform fabric remains its most underappreciated attribute.

text.medium: I am very tired, so I want to go to sleep right now.
text.hard: The somnolent nature of this discourse compels me to immediately seek a state of unconsciousness.

text.medium: If we don't abolish uniforms, aliens will steal them all.
text.hard: We must act preemptively before extraterrestrial entities confiscate our entire textile inventory.

text.medium: The main goal of life is to buy as many expensive clothes as possible.
text.hard: The paramount objective of human existence is the unbridled accumulation of luxury garments.
